token."}}},"stateVariables":{"version":{"custom:semver":"1.0.0"}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"ERC20BridgeFinalized(address,address,address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Emitted when an chain."},"ETHBridgeFinalized(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Emitted when an ETH bridge is finalized on this chain."},"ETHBridgeInitiated(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Emitted when an ETH bridge is initiated to the other chain."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"MESSENGER()":{"notice":"Getter for messenger contract."},"MIN_GAS_DYNAMIC_OVERHEAD_DENOMINATOR()":{"notice":"Denominator for dynamic overhead added to the base gas for a message."},"MIN_GAS_DYNAMIC_OVERHEAD_NUMERATOR()":{"notice":"Numerator for dynamic overhead added to the base gas for a message."},"OTHER_BRIDGE()":{"notice":"Corresponding bridge on the other domain."},"baseGas(uint32)":{"notice":"Computes the amount of gas required to guarantee that a given deposit will be         received on the other chain without running out of gas."},"bridgeERC20(address,address,uint256,uint32,bytes)":{"notice":"Sends ERC20 tokens to the sender's address on the other chain. Note that if the         ERC20 token on the other chain does not recognize the local token as the correct         pair token, the ERC20 bridge will fail and the tokens will be returned to sender on         this chain."},"bridgeERC20To(address,address,address,uint256,uint32,bytes)":{"notice":"Sends ERC20 tokens to a receiver's address on the other chain. Note that if the         ERC20 token on the other chain does not recognize the local token as the correct         pair token, the ERC20 bridge will fail and the tokens will be returned to sender on         this chain."},"bridgeETH(uint32,bytes)":{"notice":"Sends ETH to the sender's address on the other chain."},"bridgeETHTo(address,uint32,bytes)":{"notice":"Sends ETH to a receiver's address on the other chain. Note that if ETH is sent to a         smart contract and the call fails, the ETH will be temporarily locked in the         StandardBridge on the other chain until the call is replayed. If the call cannot be         replayed with any amount of gas (call always reverts), then the ETH will be         permanently locked in the StandardBridge on the other chain. ETH will also         be locked if the receiver is the other bridge, because finalizeBridgeETH will revert         in that case."},"constructor":{"notice":"Constructs the L1PatexBridge contract."},"deposits(address,address)":{"notice":"Mapping that stores deposits for a given pair of local and remote tokens."},"ethYieldManager()":{"notice":"Address of the ETH Yield Manager."},"ethYieldTokens(address)":{"notice":"Mapping of potential deposit tokens to whether they're         approved as ETH yield tokens and additional metadata."},"finalizeBridgeERC20(address,address,address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Finalizes an ERC20 bridge on this chain. Can only be triggered by the other         PatexBridge contract on the remote chain."},"finalizeBridgeETH(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Patex: This function is modified from StandardBridge to enable discounted withdrawals on L1. The `msg.value` check is less strict and `msg.value` is used instead of `_amount` in the following steps."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address)":{"notice":"Initializer"},"messenger()":{"notice":"Messenger contract on this domain. This public getter is deprecated         and will be removed in the future. Please use `messenger` instead."},"otherBridge()":{"notice":"Getter for the remote domain bridge contract."},"portal()":{"notice":"Address of the PatexPortal."},"setETHYieldToken(address,bool,uint8,address,bool)":{"notice":"Add/remove an approved ETH yield token."},"setUSDYieldToken(address,bool,uint8,address,bool)":{"notice":"Add/remove an approved USD yield token."},"usdYieldManager()":{"notice":"Address of the USD Yield Manager."},"usdYieldTokens(address)":{"notice":"Mapping of potential deposit tokens to whether they're         approved as USD yield tokens and additional metadata."},"version()":{"notice":"Semantic version."}},"notice":"The L1PatexBridge is responsible for transferring ETH and yield-bearing ERC20 tokens between L1 and L2.         The current implementation converts all deposited USD tokens to DAI before bridging them to L2 to mint USDB.         Hence, the amount of USDB that is minted on L2 will be equal to the amount of DAI that is received on L1.         This is done to simplify the yield management, as DSR is the only yield provider that is currently supported.         When non-DAI USD tokens are deposited, the user is expected to provide the minimum amount of DAI that should         be received (i.e. the minimum amount of USDB that should be minted on L2). This amount must be specified         in the extraData field of the deposit transaction (uint256 minAmountInWad).","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"contracts/mainnet-bridge/L1PatexBridge.sol":"L1PatexBridge"},"evmVersion":"london","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"none"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":999999},"remappings":[":@ensdomains/=node_modules/@ensdomains/",":@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/=node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/",":@openzeppelin/contracts/=node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/",":@rari-capital/solmate/=node_modules/@rari-capital/solmate/",":ds-test/=node_modules/ds-test/src/",":forge-std/=node_modules/forge-std/src/",":hardhat-deploy/=node_modules/hardhat-deploy/",":hardhat/=node_modules/hardhat/",":solmate/=node_modules/solmate/"]},"sources":{"contracts/L1/L2OutputOracle.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3b1acc7a00c75d33d6d7675c4a48a5f5f151f4b3c1e6e03e80efbef2aac9ae1e","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://0327d3ca241a15a21dc13df5dd071cc5e516c1cbb159d3dbec796a549aa54673","dweb:/ipfs/QmYftaYagkgW2PZDpkZQiWYq29SFsKCG6D9ARniQGhbP29"]},"contracts/L1/PatexPortal.sol":{"keccak256":"0x74081398d116e44666402440abeb685dfac830439d27b24c1b0bd5f958fae182","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://a25dac049ca80870c4149c32ea754e55f7a5c08ecea7d10e4ac14e7329b48c82","dweb:/ipfs/QmPWHGU3W5sNLEVJUeZWQYhMWakG2P5wGiJkYfFALYRmx5"]},"contracts/L1/ResourceMetering.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5283ad9ddfc17c15e7b26d2839103560936df3c824d2f50462bb5de8a9e27116","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://7b11bbd9a7f7143fc1163ab0a0f1d93674fbb81a8c6ca7ceb453ac4a23ad77d9","dweb:/ipfs/QmXzpueNeWRh5ViVomZS2rHRqojx2skNYStHfDzxfAgowp"]},"contracts/L1/SystemConfig.sol":{"keccak256":"0x469be81ed66b0d3ecdcfc5c79007adf3036b39a6102635ddc8ebab0d72c743a0","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://188762979094e90074e0d465d13758bd9044de80456d010ce6976565c85820b1","dweb:/ipfs/QmfGicjXSPbJM3UqiT9wRYgkrUGVtg8Pt4PK3ik2VuHmRS"]},"contracts/L2/Patex.sol":{"keccak256":"0x7a68c75e852e31700befa018dd9b16697901ecf2ec9ffb955907936c40edb978","license":"BSL params._minGasLimit: Minimum desired gas limit when deposit goes to target.

returns._0: Amount of gas required to guarantee deposit receipt.

params._amount: Amount of local tokens to deposit.
params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC20 on this chain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum amount of gas that the bridge can be relayed with.
params._remoteToken: Address of the corresponding token on the remote chain.

params._amount: Amount of local tokens to deposit.
params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC20 on this chain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum amount of gas that the bridge can be relayed with.
params._remoteToken: Address of the corresponding token on the remote chain.

params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum amount of gas that the bridge can be relayed with.

params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum amount of gas that the bridge can be relayed with.

params._amount: Amount of the ERC20 being bridged.
params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC20 on this chain.
params._remoteToken: Address of the corresponding token on the remote chain.

params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                   not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                   to identify the transaction.

params.approved: Whether the token is an approved yield token.
params.provider: Address of the yield provider for the token.
params.reportStakedBalance: Whether a deposit needs to be reported to the yield provider.

params.approved: Whether the token is an approved yield token.
params.provider: Address of the yield provider for the token.
params.reportStakedBalance: Whether a deposit needs to be reported to the yield provider.

MIN_GAS_DYNAMIC_OVERHEAD_DENOMINATOR().notice: Denominator for dynamic overhead added to the base gas for a message.

MIN_GAS_DYNAMIC_OVERHEAD_NUMERATOR().notice: Numerator for dynamic overhead added to the base gas for a message.

OTHER_BRIDGE().notice: Corresponding bridge on the other domain.

baseGas(uint32).notice: Computes the amount of gas required to guarantee that a given deposit will be         received on the other chain without running out of gas.

bridgeERC20(address,address,uint256,uint.notice: Sends ERC20 tokens to the sender's address on the other chain. Note that if the         ERC20 token on the other chain does not recognize the local token as the correct         pair token, the ERC20 bridge will fail and the tokens will be returned to sender on         this chain.

bridgeERC20To(address,address,address,ui.notice: Sends ERC20 tokens to a receiver's address on the other chain. Note that if the         ERC20 token on the other chain does not recognize the local token as the correct         pair token, the ERC20 bridge will fail and the tokens will be returned to sender on         this chain.

bridgeETH(uint32,bytes).notice: Sends ETH to the sender's address on the other chain.

bridgeETHTo(address,uint32,bytes).notice: Sends ETH to a receiver's address on the other chain. Note that if ETH is sent to a         smart contract and the call fails, the ETH will be temporarily locked in the         StandardBridge on the other chain until the call is replayed. If the call cannot be         replayed with any amount of gas (call always reverts), then the ETH will be         permanently locked in the StandardBridge on the other chain. ETH will also         be locked if the receiver is the other bridge, because finalizeBridgeETH will revert         in that case.

deposits(address,address).notice: Mapping that stores deposits for a given pair of local and remote tokens.

ethYieldManager().notice: Address of the ETH Yield Manager.

ethYieldTokens(address).notice: Mapping of potential deposit tokens to whether they're         approved as ETH yield tokens and additional metadata.

finalizeBridgeERC20(address,address,addr.notice: Finalizes an ERC20 bridge on this chain. Can only be triggered by the other         PatexBridge contract on the remote chain.

finalizeBridgeETH(address,address,uint25.notice: Patex: This function is modified from StandardBridge to enable discounted withdrawals on L1. The `msg.value` check is less strict and `msg.value` is used instead of `_amount` in the following steps.

messenger().notice: Messenger contract on this domain. This public getter is deprecated         and will be removed in the future. Please use `messenger` instead.

otherBridge().notice: Getter for the remote domain bridge contract.

setETHYieldToken(address,bool,uint8,addr.notice: Add/remove an approved ETH yield token.

setUSDYieldToken(address,bool,uint8,addr.notice: Add/remove an approved USD yield token.

usdYieldManager().notice: Address of the USD Yield Manager.

usdYieldTokens(address).notice: Mapping of potential deposit tokens to whether they're         approved as USD yield tokens and additional metadata.

ERC20BridgeFinalized(address,address,add.notice: Emitted when an ERC20 bridge is finalized on this chain.

ERC20BridgeInitiated(address,address,add.notice: Emitted when an ERC20 bridge is initiated to the other chain.

ETHBridgeFinalized(address,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when an ETH bridge is finalized on this chain.

ETHBridgeInitiated(address,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when an ETH bridge is initiated to the other chain.

userdoc.notice: The L1PatexBridge is responsible for transferring ETH and yield-bearing ERC20 tokens between L1 and L2.         The current implementation converts all deposited USD tokens to DAI before bridging them to L2 to mint USDB.         Hence, the amount of USDB that is minted on L2 will be equal to the amount of DAI that is received on L1.         This is done to simplify the yield management, as DSR is the only yield provider that is currently supported.         When non-DAI USD tokens are deposited, the user is expected to provide the minimum amount of DAI that should         be received (i.e. the minimum amount of USDB that should be minted on L2). This amount must be specified         in the extraData field of the deposit transaction (uint256 minAmountInWad).
